required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics and Excretion of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide (AMG 416) in Patients With End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Receiving Dialysis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-dose Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Biotransformation and Excretion of [¹⁴C]AMG 416 in Patients With End Stage Renal Disease Receiving Dialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objectives of this study were to determine the rate, extent, and routes of radioactivity excretion of [¹⁴C]etelcalcetide in feces, dialysate, and urine over time and to measure radioactivity concentrations in whole blood and plasma over time.

detailed_description.textblock:
Six adult male or female patients with end stage renal disease requiring hemodialysis will be enrolled to receive 750 nCi of [¹⁴C]-labeled etelcalcetide formulated in 10 mg etelcalcetide administered as a single 2 mL intravenous dose at the end of hemodialysis.
Participants will spend the first approximately 12 days in confinement at the clinic (day -1 until completion of day 11 study procedures). Blood samples, and complete collections of dialysate, dialysis membrane (as necessary), urine (as available), and feces will be analyzed for radioactivity content by accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS). Following the confinement period, participants will return to the site on an outpatient basis in accordance to their routine dialysis sessions up to day 39. Blood and dialysate samples and dialysis membranes will be collected at specified times during the outpatient visit period.
Participants may be asked to return so the site for the Extended Pharmacokinetic Collection Period. During the Extended Pharmacokinetic Collection Period, participants will return to the site for 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions (Collection Period 1) and then again approximately one month later, for an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions (Collection Period 2).

primary_outcome.description: The total radioactivity in excreta (urine and feces) or dialysate and dialysis membrane is expressed as a percentage of the total radioactive [¹⁴C] administered (dose). Total radioactive counts in dialysate, dialyzer, feces, and urine were determined by accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS). Radioactivity excreted during non-sampled days was estimated by interpolation and extrapolation of the measured data.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.
primary_outcome.description: Total radioactive counts in plasma was determined by accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS).

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Concentration (Cmax) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Last Observed Plasma Concentration of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Last Observed Plasma Concentration (Clast) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Half-life (T½) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 3 Days Post-dose (AUC3d) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 10 Days Post-dose (AUC10d) of [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide-derived Radioactivity in Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Arterial Plasma Concentration-time Curve Obtained During Hemodialysis on Day 4 for Etelcalcetide
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4 within 10 minutes after the start of hemodialysis, at 2 hours after the start of hemodialysis, and within 10 minutes before the end of hemodialysis.
primary_outcome.description: Etelcalcetide plasma concentrations were determined by liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Venous Plasma Concentration-time Curve Obtained During Hemodialysis on Day 4 for Etelcalcetide
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4 within 10 minutes after the start of hemodialysis, at 2 hours after the start of hemodialysis, and within 10 minutes before the end of hemodialysis.
primary_outcome.description: Etelcalcetide plasma concentrations were determined by liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of Etelcalcetide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.
secondary_outcome.description: Etelcalcetide plasma concentrations were determined by liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Last Observed Plasma Concentration of Etelcalcetide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

secondary_outcome.measure: Last Observed Plasma Concentration (Clast) of Etelcalcetide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 3 Days Post-dose (AUC3d) of Etelcalcetide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 10 Days Post-dose (AUC10d) of Etelcalcetide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected from pre-dose on day 1 to day 39; additional samples were collected at 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 129 -148 and approximately 1 month later at an additional 3 consecutive hemodialysis sessions from days 157-176.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemodialysis Clearance of Etelcalcetide During Hemodialysis on Day 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4 within 10 minutes after the start of hemodialysis, at 2 hours after the start of hemodialysis, and within 10 minutes before the end of hemodialysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemodialysis Extraction Ratio for Etelcalcetide During Hemodialysis on Day 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 4 within 10 minutes after the start of hemodialysis, at 2 hours after the start of hemodialysis, and within 10 minutes before the end of hemodialysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of etelcalcetide to day 39
secondary_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event (TRAE) is any adverse event (AE) that per investigator review has a reasonable possibility of being caused by the investigational product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-etelcalcetide Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of anti-etelcalcetide antibodies was assessed and confirmed using a dual-flow cell biosensor immunoassay at baseline (day -1) and at the end of study visit (day 39).

clinical_study.condition: Secondary Hyperparathyroidism in Patients With ESRD on Hemodialysis

arm_group.description: Participants received a single dose of 10 mg radiolabelled etelcalcetide administered by intravenous (IV) bolus injection at the end of hemodialysis on day 1.

intervention.description: 750 nCi of [¹⁴C]etelcalcetide formulated as a single 10 mg dose of etelcaletide in 2 mL liquid solution for bolus intravenous (IV) administration at the end of hemodialysis.

reference.citation: Wu L, Melhem M, Subramanian R, Wu B. Drug disposition model of radiolabeled etelcalcetide in patients with chronic kidney disease and secondary hyperparathyroidism on hemodialysis. J Pharmacokinet Pharmacodyn. 2017 Feb;44(1):43-53. doi: 10.1007/s10928-016-9503-z. Epub 2017 Jan 6.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at a single center in the United States from 07 February 2014 to 15 August 2014.

outcome.title: Cumulative Excretion of Radioactivity
outcome.description: The total radioactivity in excreta (urine and feces) or dialysate and dialysis membrane is expressed as a percentage of the total radioactive [¹⁴C] administered (dose). Total radioactive counts in dialysate, dialyzer, feces, and urine were determined by accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS). Radioactivity excreted during non-sampled days was estimated by interpolation and extrapolation of the measured data.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to day 176
outcome.population: Participants who received any amount of [¹⁴C]etelcalcetide with available excretion data

outcome.population: Participants who received any amount of [¹⁴C]etalcalcetide

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of etelcalcetide to day 39.
reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events summarizes the non-serious occurrences of adverse events that exceed the indicated frequency threshold.

group.title: [¹⁴C]Etelcalcetide
group.description: Participants received a single dose of 10 mg radiolabelled etelcalcetide administered by IV bolus at the end of hemodialysis on day 1.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
